additionalInfo.description: A free space containing any additional information related to a particular object. A data source may provide any JSON object, unrestricted by the BrAPI specification.

copyright.description: The copyright information of this image. Example 'Copyright 2018 Bob Robertson'

description.description: The human readable description of an image.

descriptiveOntologyTerms.description: A list of terms to formally describe the image. Each item could be a simple Tag, an Ontology reference Id, or a full ontology URL.

externalReferences.description: An array of external reference ids. These are references to this piece of data in an external system. Could be a simple string or a URI.
externalReferences.title: ExternalReferences

imageDbId.description: The unique identifier of an image

imageFileName.description: The name of the image file. Might be the same as 'imageName', but could be different.

imageFileSize.description: The size of the image in Bytes.

imageHeight.description: The height of the image in Pixels.

imageLocation.description:
One geometry as defined by GeoJSON (RFC 7946). All coordinates are decimal values on the WGS84 geographic coordinate reference system.

Copied from RFC 7946 Section 3.1.1

A position is an array of numbers. There MUST be two or more elements. The first two elements are longitude and latitude, or
easting and northing, precisely in that order and using decimal numbers. Altitude or elevation MAY be included as an optional third element.

geometry.description: A geometry as defined by GeoJSON (RFC 7946). In this context, only Point or Polygon geometry are allowed.

imageLocation.title: GeoJSON

imageName.description: The human readable name of an image. Might be the same as 'imageFileName', but could be different.

imageTimeStamp.description: The date and time the image was taken

imageURL.description: The complete, absolute URI path to the image file. Images might be stored on a different host or path than the BrAPI web server.

imageWidth.description: The width of the image in Pixels.

mimeType.description: The file type of the image. Examples 'image/jpeg', 'image/png', 'image/svg', etc

observationUnit.description: The related observation unit identifier, if relevant.

observations.description: A list of observation Ids this image is associated with, if applicable.
